protocol_name: Cell Culture Transfection of HEK293 with cDNA and/or siRNA
protocol_name_html: Cell Culture Transfection of HEK293 with cDNA and/or siRNA
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/ud3iuae.xlsx","file_id":"18553","thumb_url":"/img/extensions/xlsx.png","ofn":"20180307 Cell Culture Transfection with cDNA:siRNA Template from Ellison Lab.xlsx"}]
description: Basic protocol to achieve lipofectamine transfection of Human Embryonic Kidney 293 (HEK293) cells with cDNA and/or siRNA.
before_start:
Make complete DMEM:

 

Reagent Volume
DMEM 432.5 mL
FBS 50 mL
Pen/Strep 5 mL
HEPES (1M, pH 7.4) 12.5 mL

materials.reagent_name: HyClone Classical Liquid Media Dulbeccos Modified Eagles Medium (DMEM)

warning:
• Human Embryonic Kidney (HEK293) cells are biosafety level 2 (BSL-2) and should be handled according to the CDC's Biosafety in Microbiological and Biomedical Laboratories (BMBL) guidelines. They are considered BSL-2 not because they are inherently hazardous or infectious, but because of their potential to be infected with pathogens and in turn infect their handlers. Due to the impossibility to regularly screen this cell like for every human pathogen, HEK293 cells should always be handled as potentially infectious. Other BSL-2 cell lines include those positive for Legionella pneumophila, HIV, and other disease-causing pathogens in humans.

  • Dispose of ALL waste that comes into contact with cells such as pipettes, gloves, and materials as biohazardous waste.

  • Bleach all direct cell waste thoroughly. In our lab, our vacuum line tube empties in to a sealed waste jug with bleach already added to the bottom of it, making up at least 10% of the total volume. This way, aspirated media and cells immediately come into contact with the bleach. Before disposing of glass pipettes, we aspirate a small amount of 10% bleach through to clean both the pipette and tubing, then dispose of the pipettes as biohazardous sharps.
keywords: transfection, cell culture, hek293, siRNA knockdown
guidelines: If protein yields are low following this method, it may be worthwhile to use complete DMEM without Pen/Strep. In this protocol, we op to use complete DMEM with Pen/Strep even though yields may be lower.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: Prepare
components.name: Section

components.data: One day prior to transfection, plate cells at a concentration of 500,000 cells per mL in a 12-well plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: One day prior to transfection, plate cells at a concentration of 500,000 cells per mL in a 12-well plate.

components.data: Prepare Master Mixes
components.name: Section

components.data: According to the transfection spreadsheet, label master mixes in 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes for each triplicate condition. First, add Opti-Mem to the master mix tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: According to the transfection spreadsheet, label master mixes in 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes for each triplicate condition. First, add Opti-Mem to the master mix tubes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 6 of Cell Culture Transfection with cDNA/siRNA
source_data.protocol_name: Cell Culture Transfection of HEK293 with cDNA and/or siRNA
source_data.protocol_name_html: Cell Culture Transfection of HEK293 with cDNA and/or siRNA
source_data.annotation: Be as accurate as possible: for example, use P1000 to add 340µL, then P20 to add remainder e.g. 12.1 µL.
source_data.thread_text: Be as accurate as possible: for example, use P1000 to add 340µL, then P20 to add remainder e.g. 12.1 µL.
source_data.body: Be as accurate as possible: for example, use P1000 to add 340µL, then P20 to add remainder e.g. 12.1 µL.

components.data: Prepare Master Mixes
components.name: Section

components.data: Double check that concentrations of cDNA/siRNA match the transfection spreadsheet. Mix thoroughly by flicking, then add the cDNA/siRNA to the Opti-Mem master mix tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Double check that concentrations of cDNA/siRNA match the transfection spreadsheet. Mix thoroughly by flicking, then add the cDNA/siRNA to the Opti-Mem master mix tubes.

components.data: To the lipofectamine master mix: add lipofectamine to Opti-Mem, mix well, and then let the solution sit for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To the lipofectamine master mix: add lipofectamine to Opti-Mem, mix well, and then let the solution sit for 5 minutes.

components.data: Prepare Master Mixes
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare Master Mixes
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the diluted lipofectamine to cDNA/siRNA at 1:1 ratio. [+350 µL] Mix well. Let solution sit for at least 20 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted lipofectamine to cDNA/siRNA at 1:1 ratio. [+350 µL] Mix well. Let solution sit for at least 20 minutes.

components.data: Transfect
components.name: Section

components.data: On the plated cells, label wells in triplicate for each treatment. Be sure to number them to match the transfection spreadsheet. Mix the Lipofectamine + Master Mix solution thoroughly and add 200 µL of each respective mix in a careful, dropwise circular motion. Do not pipette directly on to cells in a stream.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: On the plated cells, label wells in triplicate for each treatment. Be sure to number them to match the transfection spreadsheet. Mix the Lipofectamine + Master Mix solution thoroughly and add 200 µL of each respective mix in a careful, dropwise circular motion. Do not pipette directly on to cells in a stream.

source_data.title: from each respective Master Mix to plated cells.

components.data: Incubate
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix the media with very gentle shaking, then return the cells to the incubator at 37°C and 5% CO2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the media with very gentle shaking, then return the cells to the incubator at 37°C and 5% CO2.

components.data: Prepare
components.name: Section

components.data: Sterilize the biosafety cabinet with 10% bleach for 20 minutes. Spray down the biosafety cabinet with 70% ethanol and use UV light for 15 minutes as a secondary decontaminant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sterilize the biosafety cabinet with 10% bleach for 20 minutes. Spray down the biosafety cabinet with 70% ethanol and use UV light for 15 minutes as a secondary decontaminant.

components.data: Prepare
components.name: Section

components.data: Modify the transfection spreadsheet (attached) to calculate how much cDNA/siRNA is needed for experimental conditions. Make sure to include negative controls for the total amount of DNA or siRNA that is added.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Modify the transfection spreadsheet (attached) to calculate how much cDNA/siRNA is needed for experimental conditions. Make sure to include negative controls for the total amount of DNA or siRNA that is added.

components.data: Freshen Up the Media (Day 2)
components.name: Section

components.data: The next day, aspirate the old media three wells at a time and add 1 mL of warm complete DMEM media.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next day, aspirate the old media three wells at a time and add 1 mL of warm complete DMEM media.

components.data: The following day, plan for cell lysis, protein assay, and gel sample preparation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The following day, plan for cell lysis, protein assay, and gel sample preparation.

components.data: Further Experiments (Day 3)
components.name: Section

components.data: One Hour Prior to Transfection
components.name: Section

components.data: Three wells at a time, aspirate all media from plated cells with a sterile glass pipette. Gently but quickly replace with 800 µL fresh warm complete DMEM, careful not to pipette vigorously enough to cause cells to detach.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Three wells at a time, aspirate all media from plated cells with a sterile glass pipette. Gently but quickly replace with 800 µL fresh warm complete DMEM, careful not to pipette vigorously enough to cause cells to detach.
